body: The hive tests all pass clean now with this change.  Think it's ready for merge once the check tests pass after this small NULL pointer check change. But the merge to master needs to be done by squashing all the commits into one !   The text to be used can be the header of this PR.

A parser-only approach is good for now. It makes WITH entirely a syntactic sugar in Trafodion.

In the future, we'll want to reconsider this. WITH (without RECURSIVE) is a form of manual common sub-expression elimination. Some merchant database engines have multiple possible plans for these queries: The subquery could be evaluated once and materialized, then that result is plugged into the query tree wherever needed. Or the subquery can be "inlined", meaning that it will be re-evaluated each time it is encountered. A syntax-only approach doesn't allow us to do this. Though I could imagine that if we put relational common-subexpression logic into our normalizer, we could then consider it.

A minor issue with the syntax-only approach is that if a subquery in the WITH clause is not referenced, we don't do any error checking on it. So, I could say, WITH T1 AS (SELECT \* FROM NON_EXISTENT_TABLE) SELECT \* FROM EXISTING_TABLE and not get an error. I don't know what the standard says about this or what other products do. It is good enough for now.
Yes, looks good to merge to me.
Looks fine ! WIll merge this now.

That's correct. Initially for experimenting I had added the retry loop at  the lowest level. It did not help. The retry with this error after further debugging we found was due to a query cache issue and required recompilation.   Hence removed all the local retries and made it an AQR retry. Also the errno is captured immediately after hdfsOpenFile and then passed as an output param all the way to the Scan TCB layer. Is there anything that's missing ?
@amandamoran i think add hbase_distro to traf_conf_setup is good
It looks good to me. Squash away!

@DaveBirdsall  , yes, this is only the initial attempt to support with_clause. We need to find better ways to improve this in the later iteration. This is only a syntax sugar as you described. 
I am thinking: this will treat the with_clause just as a subquery, so if it is used only once in a query, all same optimizations Trafodion uses for subquery should be able to apply as well, such as subquery to join, or materialize result once, etc. I cannot see any difference, I will do some experiment after the syntax and all above issues solved. Write a query and check the plan. 
In the JIRA 1673, QiFan proposed a new CTE processing idea, that should be implemented in later iteration.
in sum, this is just an initial effort, and I think it is more about parser, and all parser changes can be reused in later iterations.

@selvaganesang trafci works with this with_clause as well. 
@venkat1m how to check repository compatibility? Is there any hint where should I look at?

The problem with upgrade when privileges were enabled has been fixed. As part of the fix, I needed to refactor how subsystems are upgraded, separating the final drop and the undo steps from the main upgrade step. I did a full refactoring for the repository subsystem, and put in place the framework for refactoring the privilege manager subsystem. The privilege manager subsystem upgrade logic is not fully developed yet (because we haven't made changes to those tables yet); at that time the privilege manager logic refactoring should be completed as well.
Thanks for doing this refactoring.  It looks good and the comments are useful to describe our upgrade plans.
Looks good to me. Happy committing/publishing!
@amandamoran So , you will do the 'add HBASE_DISTRO' in another PR? or I just add it in this PR ?
Please edit the subject line to convey what this PR does. It would be helpful when someone uses git log to determine what are the changes that went in

. Using [TRAFODION-1743]  instead of jira1743 is suggested so that PR can be automatically linked to the Trafodion jira. Also, please edit the subject line of this PR so that it conveys what it does. When someone looks at git log later, it would be helpful.

Can we pass optionally pass a property to indicate some kind of client information as part of the connection. And this can be used to identify the client of T2 driver and in the session name.
Looks good. I think I found a bug in an existing code path (not in your changes).
Probably a good idea to run extra tests with this change. I will trigger that.

Changes look good to me. Please have HBASE_DISTRO set by installer in trafodion user bashrc so that correct settings are picked up from sqenvcom.sh when trafodion user logs in.  Also please do basic tests with different distros using the installer.  In the developer environment, please run full developer regression tests.

@robertamarton, I've made two of the changes you suggested (adding logging, and adding enums). For one of your other suggestions, I've created a JIRA TRAFODION-2111 and will address that matter seperately.

I will remove the wrong 'delete $1; delete $4' and fix the regression failure and make another commit, please help to review again. 

RECURSIVE is now a TOKEN , so I change the core/TEST037 to remove it as a reserved word test.

I plan to make next commit next Monday.

modify the yacc file to remove the reduce/reduce conflict. The reduce/reduce seems to be related between no_rollback and query_expression, but very hard to make it correct.

ANSI defined 'with clause' is as Hans pointed out, in Trafodion yacc:

```
       query_expression : non_join_query_expression
            |   with_clause non_join_query_expression
```

What I proposed to define is:

```
         dml_statement : dml_query { $$ = $1; }

           | with_clause dml_query
             {
               $$ = $2;
             }

      dml_query : query_expression order_by_clause access_type
        optional_lock_mode for_update_spec optional_limit_spec

      | query_expression order_by_clause_non_empty
        group_by_clause_non_empty access_type optional_lock_mode
        for_update_spec optional_limit_spec
```

From syntax point of view, these two definitions are same, and ANSI has no dml_query definition, so we cannot 100% aligned with ANSI grammar IMHO.

The second definition will not introduce new reduce/reduce or shift/reduce conflict. I will run a extra test after normal test finished.
i do some conflect in #568 ... now recreate a PR

It is not clear if the checked ulimits need to have these values. For eq, Trafodion can support upto 65535 pids only. /proc/sys/kernel/pid_max should be set to a value less than 65535.  So, max user processes ulimit value has no bearing. Do we know which ulimit that is not properly set got into hang?

Very nice, very elegant, very simple!! I love how these few lines of change enable such a big feature. Two small comments, but I think we should commit this code and address the comments later. One is in line comments, we may need a couple of error messages. Here is a second comment: Putting the WITH clause as part of a DML statement works fine at the top level, but it does not allow WITH clauses in query expressions that are not at the top level. I think the ANSI standard allows those. My suggestion: Let's live with that restriction for now, the WITH clause makes the most sense at the outermost level.
The fix looks good to me.
Am going to ignore the JDBC test failure, the test doesn't exercise the changed code and therefore must be caused by something else.

These four ulimit setting is from Trafodion installer, which set all of them, So this checking is to sync with official Trafodion installer for developers who not run trafodion_install, but install_local_hadoop and build Trafodion from source code. It is common that new developers ignore the ulimit settings and will meet various problems. 
These checkings will print warnings to the developer, so as a reminder for them to correct the ulimit, instead of sending email to ask around.

I checked all four ulimit one by one and the real one that block the sqstart is the 'ulimit -l'. But I assume there must be some reason Trafodion set four ulimit, if 'ulimit -u' is not required, we should also remove it from trafodion_install, and remove it from here.

However, this checking will not block the sqstart, just print some warning, in case the user do meet problems.

I am fine to remove the checking of 'ulimit -u'. But this does not do any harm since it is a WARNING. There are many settings : ulimit settings, hbase settings are not clear anymore, the original author of those changes were not active now. So it is hard to decide if it is required or not.

Very good to not see Error 201 and instead the real error stack trace! 
One minor question is: if for some reason, HDFS cannot write, and it may affect all error rows, will each write attempt generate a new SQL warning and is it possible to make the diagArea too big? Or you keep just the last SQL error?
